Title: Manager, Procurement Operations
RoleDescription:
This position is a hybrid in-office role that works out of our Headquarters in Boston, MA (this role is not a virtual / remote position). 4 days in office/ 1 day WFH
Wayfair is looking for a Manager on our Procurement Product team to drive the ongoing optimization of our cloud-based procure-to-pay system and subsequent spend processes. This highly visible role is pivotal to standardizing our firm-wide buying process, improving our downstream financial operations, tracking spend data, unlocking process efficiencies, and maximizing our teams return on investment. We are looking for adaptable doers who are great at engaging with stakeholders, questioning inefficiencies, using data to solve problems, and multi-tasking. 
As the lead Product Manager, you will need to understand the needs of cross-functional partners across finance, accounting, engineering, and the business - then translate them into a product strategy and roadmap for our suite of Procurement tools, including Coupa, Contract Lifecycle Management, and Vendor Management System. You will need to be skilled at navigating a multitude of strong ideas, selecting the ones that will drive our agenda the furthest, and communicating the priorities back to our partners. As the internal expert and guru of our procure-to-pay systems, youll then roll up your sleeves with the Procurement Operations and partner teams to get the work done. 
You will bring a strong background in Product and/or Procurement best practices and help to drive the discovery effort of new features as well as the execution of ongoing ones. This role is ideal for someone who's both business and tech-savvy and thrives in a fast-paced environment. 
What You'll Do

Create and drive a roadmap aimed at revamping our procure-to-pay system, with a focus on results and the experience of users.
Partner with stakeholders and senior leaders across departments to understand needs, identify gaps in current processes, define product design and functional requirements, and implement a system roadmap to drive business impact.
Lead the implementation of a vendor management system.
Oversee system updates and manage the ongoing relationship with our vendor; coordinate associated change management efforts as necessary.
Develop and monitor functional performance metrics (KPIs) and devise/deploy strategies for ongoing program optimization.
Create reporting suite to distribute to category sourcing and cross-functional connections to highlight trends and opportunities to reduce spend through sourcing efforts, catalog enablement, and process improvement. 
Collaborate with engineering to review, prioritize, and action system enhancement requests and reconfigurations.

What You'll Need

4+ years experience in Product Management, procurement operations/sourcing, systems management, or strategy consultancy; experience with a cloud-based P2P system is a plus.
Bachelors degree required and preferred in an analytical field, such as economics, engineering, business, math, statistics, science, or analytics.
Ability to thrive in a high growth and entrepreneurial environment where strong project management skills and the ability to juggle multiple priorities are a must.
Ability to work cooperatively and collaboratively with all levels of employees and executive management.
Articulate and persuasive communication skills, both written and verbal.
A track record of successful relationship management skills.
An ability to hit the ground running and learn quickly; a self-starter.

Title: Software Engineer II, Frontend Platform
RoleDescription:
Candidates for this position are preferred to be based in Boston, MA and will be expected to comply with their team's hybrid work schedule requirements
Who We Are:
Storefront Engineering is in the enviable position of being able to speak directly to our customers. Through powerful technology, we make shopping our millions of products feel simple and personal, whether customers are just browsing while on-the-go on our native app or finalizing purchase decisions on the desktop from the comfort of their home.
As Wayfair continues to see massive growth, Storefront Engineering is going through a major technology transition, empowering teams to build services and interfaces that can be updated and deployed independently. We are on the journey to build the tools and services to deliver value to our customers more quickly, all in an environment where engineering teams have the autonomy to make the right decision for themselves and their product.
About The Team:
Wayfair is a leader in the e-commerce space for all things home. We live and breathe modern technologies. Were looking for smart, innovative thinkers who can assist in the creation of scalable designs of our frontend tooling and architecture. We are as much concerned about thought leadership, community involvement, and the ever-changing landscape as we are with technical skills!
As a Software Engineer II, youll have a multitude of opportunities to grow your engineering expertise while learning from experienced peers as you contribute to the implementation of cutting-edge frontend technologies at scale. The frontend platform team is responsible for building out the design, tooling, and best practices that enable frontend engineers to build robust, scalable, and performant web experiences to the delight of our customers and millions of daily requests.
What Youll Do:

Assist in building and maintaining a Next.js e-commerce platform that serves millions of requests per day through Kubernetes on Google Cloud.
Collaborate with the team to adopt Server Components, Server Side Suspense and React 19 functionality to help Wayfair deliver a world class, performant experience.
Support the development and maintenance of monorepo tooling that powers deployment, build processes, and local development for all Wayfair developers.
Learn and contribute to Server Driven UI patterns to support platform-based architecture patterns.
Engage in open source contributions that align with Wayfairs platform needs and community-driven initiatives.

What Youll Need:

Foundational experience with frontend web development (React, etc).
Interest in and some experience with frontend build tooling (Next.js, webpack, etc).
Familiarity with building and working with GraphQL APIs.
Interest in and some experience with build and deploy pipelines (e.g. Github, Buildkite, Argo, Kubernetes, Google Cloud)
Exposure to working at scale (lots of developers & web traffic) is a plus.
A growth mindset, strong collaboration skills, and the ability to contribute to complex projects.
Curiosity, a desire to learn and the ability to figure things out. A debugging mindset!
Team focused with a desire to grow together and mentor others.

Benefits & Perks:

Full health benefits available (Medical, Dental, Vision, HSA/FSA) on day one for eligible employees.
No-cost access to 2nd.MD, a virtual expert medical consultation and navigation service.
Global Traveler Health Insurance through GeoBlue.
24/7 access to mental, financial, physical and emotional wellbeing support, plus an enhanced offering of therapy and coaching.
Automatic enrollment into Basic Life and Accidental Death & Disability Insurance.
401(k) matching with immediate vesting.
Paid Parental Leave, Surrogacy & Adoption Reimbursement and Caregiver Services.
Tuition Reimbursement.
Wayfair Employee Discount.
Gym/Fitness Discounts (including Peloton, Wellhub and varying regional memberships).
Exclusive access to thousands of perks & discounts through BenefitHub.
Yearly match up to $500 for personal donations made by employees to registered 501(c)(3) nonprofits.

Title: Workflow Control Manager - McDonough
RoleDescription:
The role plays a vital role in staffing, planning, and achieving site specific goals across Wayfair's Fulfillment Network. They work to ensure the accurate, timely, and cost efficient processing of the perfect order to our customers.
What You'll Do

You will create daily operating plans for a site and resolve variances between plan, actuals, and goals. Responsible for building plans at this cadence to align with Site Director and network priorities.
You will monitor plans and work in process backlogs to consider impacts of future planning and staffing
You will provide input to strategic shift planning at the site to ensure the building is staffed according to mid-long term volume projections
Coordinate with local site operations and central planning teams to analyze historical data and forecast demand for that site
Manage and interpret the analyses of daily, weekly, and monthly reporting of site performance via Key Performance Indicators (Service Level Commitments)
You will be able to engage at shift level, in real time to make proactive changes to support execution of the daily operations plan
Youll be responsible for facilitating problem solving efforts when goals are not met based on current inputs to daily plan - i.e. Attrition, Absenteeism, Productivity
You will support site operations team by optimizing staffing requirements for the site specific daily plan
You will build a strong relationship with the site operations team to ensure proper execution of the daily level capacity / throughput plan through education in visibility to data and constant communication
Work in close collaboration with Network Planning, Field Industrial Engineering, Process Definition and Standards Excellence to enable performance management improvements

What You'll Need

3+ years operational experience in distribution or manufacturing.
Able to guide and influence peers and leaders across levels and organization. Disseminate information effectively.
Capacity Planning experience or Industrial Engineering background focused on operations flow and labor management
Technical aptitude in multiple systems; understanding of Google Suite, Data Visualization platforms, basic SQL/GBQ.
Bachelors Degree in a quantitative field (engineering, economics, math, and statistics), business or equivalent
Basic and working knowledge of Six Sigma tools and Lean techniques; process focused, organized and able to assess change management requirements
Strong understanding in the use of technical/statistical tools to drive process improvements
You must be authorized to work in the United States without visa sponsorship by Wayfair now or in the future

Title: Senior Manager, Profit Management & Pricing - Wayfair Canada
RoleDescription:
About the RoleWe are seeking a strategic and results-driven Senior Manager to lead our Profit Management and Pricing team for Wayfair Canada. This role is pivotal in ensuring the long-term profitability of our business in the region by developing and executing effective pricing and investment strategies. Based in our Boston office, you will oversee a team of three talented analysts and collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive optimal financial performance.
Key Responsibilities

Pricing and Profit Margin Optimization:

Develop and implement pricing strategies to achieve optimal long-term profit margins for the Canada market.
Utilize levers such as margin setting, promotional pricing, and investment strategies to balance customer acquisition and profitability.
Drive branded pricing initiatives to align with supplier and market dynamics.

Strategic Planning and Forecasting:

Partner with the Finance team to lead profitability planning and forecasting efforts, ensuring alignment with business objectives.
Contribute to scenario modeling and sensitivity analyses to guide strategic decision-making.

Business Performance Monitoring:

Collaborate with the Business Trends team to monitor and evaluate overall business performance, identifying risks and opportunities.
Develop actionable insights from pricing performance metrics to drive continuous improvement.

Cross-Functional Leadership and Collaboration:

Be a voice of the Canadian business, working closely with Finance, Marketing, Supplier Partnerships and Operations teams to align on broader business goals, prioritize opportunities and drive action
Partner with engineering and analytics teams to enhance pricing tools and systems for improved efficiency and accuracy.

Team Leadership:

Lead and develop a high-performing team of analysts, fostering a culture of excellence and innovation.
Set clear goals, provide regular feedback, and enable professional growth within the team.


What Were Looking For

Proven Experience:

7+ years of experience in pricing, finance, or a related field, with a strong track record of driving profitability and leading teams.

Analytical Expertise:

Exceptional quantitative and analytical skills, with the ability to distill complex data into actionable insights.

Technical Skills:

Proficiency in data analysis tools (e.g., SQL, GBQ, Excel) and desire to roll-up sleeves alongside highly technical analysts to guide, review and improve code.
Experience with pricing or financial modeling tools is desirable.

Strategic Vision:

Strong strategic thinking and problem-solving skills, with the ability to navigate complex business challenges and drive results.

Leadership Skills:

Demonstrated success in leading and developing teams, fostering a collaborative and inclusive environment.

Stakeholder Management:

Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with experience working across diverse teams and levels of an organization.

Industry Knowledge:

Familiarity with e-commerce, retail, or consumer goods is a plus.

Title: Process, Audit and Jump Supervisor
RoleDescription:
Process, Audit, & Jump Supervisor - Global Transportation & Delivery
We are support partners and leaders on the Wayfair Global Supply Chain Transportation and Delivery Enablement Team.  We support our large parcel delivery locations, providing direct feedback & development to our Transportation & Delivery teams through onsite audits and training. We bring extensive process knowledge to our stakeholders and aid in the development of network-wide resources through process, audit, and training  initiatives and building audits to optimize performance and enhance employee engagement. We are culture enthusiasts throughout our entire Supply Chain network.  
We are looking for a proven leader to influence cross-functional teams responsible for development, standard work, and championing the Wayfair culture in our Middle Mile and Home Delivery Operations. The candidate must be a collaborative problem solver, strategic planner, and one who can manage & supervise high performing teams in a fast-paced, rapidly challenging, and fluid environment. 
Schedule:   

Hours for this position are five 8-hour shifts per week.
Monday - Friday 8AM-5PM, with flex to overnight shifts as needed
At times, will need to flex schedule days/times to support operational needs - including working overnight full night shifts, or working an alternate day (weekends).
Travel 75%  required, sometimes with short notice.

Location:

Role Location Options:  

City of Industry, CA
Linden, NJ
Pompano Beach, FL
Manassas, VA
Phoenix, AZ


What You'll Do

Perform regular audits of HDO Warehouses locations across the country as assigned, focusing on 5S standards and process compliance. 
Present audit findings with network leadership and provide feedback based on your onsite observations.
Follow up on previous audits to ensure that action plans have been successfully implemented.
Coordinate, lead, and execute all training functions HDO locations, including new hire orientation, job function training, new process & tech launches, and continuous development.
Lead various training sessions as needed, including but not limited to: New Hire Fundamentals, Powered Industrial Vehicle (PIV) training, Quality & Process (Current & New SOP) Training.
Use operational expertise to flex to support site operations during peak volume periods, and when needed.  Supervise the functions and working of warehouse workers while adhering to the compliance of all legal and safety procedures.
Work effectively with other managers within functional team and support new team members.
Support T&D Enablement, Safety, and Operations by championing training programs, processes, and initiatives; provide upward feedback and share observations with business owners to improve alignment, compliance, quality, and engagement.

What Youll Need

3+ years of experience in Supply Chain Leadership, Change Management OR 4 year degree in relevant field, required
Experience in Operations or Supply Chain preferred
Raymond and/or Crown forklift/powered industrial vehicle certifications preferred.  Willingness to be trained on multiple vehicle types required.
Leadership skills and the ability to make decisions with little or no guidance based on policies or best practices.
Exceptional written and verbal communication to effectively communicate with all stakeholder levels.
Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.
A seek-to-understand mindset and teamwork strategies that will allow you to connect with and influence diverse groups of people, including your training audience and stakeholder network.

RoleDescription:
About the RoleWe are seeking a strategic and results-driven Associate Director to lead our Analytics and Profit Management function for Wayfairs Specialty Retail Brands: AllModern, Joss & Main, Birch Lane, and Perigold. This role is pivotal in ensuring the long-term profitability of our business by developing and executing effective pricing and investment strategies while also providing centralized leadership of key analytics functions. Based in our Boston office, you will oversee a team of three talented analysts with dotted line responsibilities for 5-6 additional individuals across partner functions (Promotions, Finance, Supplier Analytics, Business Trends, Operations, Merchandising Operations).
Key Responsibilities

Pricing and Profit Margin Optimization:

Develop and implement pricing strategies to achieve optimal long-term profit margins for the Specialty Retail Market.
Utilize levers such as margin setting, promotional pricing, and investment strategies to balance customer acquisition and profitability.
Drive specialty pricing initiatives to align with supplier and market dynamics.

Strategic Planning and Forecasting:

Partner with the Finance team to lead profitability planning and forecasting efforts, ensuring alignment with business objectives.
Contribute to scenario modeling and sensitivity analyses to guide strategic decision-making.

Analytics Agenda Setting and Leadership:

Decide the key business performance problems that need to be solved for the SRBs; Define end-to-end performance analytics roadmap, outlining the metrics and analyses needed to support strategic decision-making.
Establish functional KPIs and frameworks to facilitate progress, tracking and trade-off decision-making.
Leverage analytics and SRB business context to drive decisions while advancing a cohesive SRB strategy. Decisions include, but are not limited to, catalog curation + assortment strategy, promo strategy and event curation, supplier WSC sourcing / opportunity identification, exclusivity goals and opportunities.

Cross-Functional Leadership and Collaboration:

Be the voice of the SRB business, working closely with Finance, Marketing, Merchant, and Supplier Partnerships teams to align on broader business goals, prioritize opportunities and drive action.
Partner with engineering and analytics teams to enhance pricing tools and systems for improved efficiency and accuracy.

Business Performance Monitoring:

Collaborate with the Business Trends team to monitor and evaluate overall business performance, identifying risks and opportunities.
Develop actionable insights from pricing performance metrics to drive continuous improvement.

Team Leadership:

Lead and develop a high-performing team of analysts, both directly and through dotted line relationships, fostering a culture of excellence and innovation.
Set clear goals, provide regular feedback, and enable professional growth within the team.

Proven Experience:

10+ years of experience in pricing, finance, or a related field, with a strong track record of driving profitability and leading teams.

Analytical Expertise:

Exceptional quantitative and analytical skills, with the ability to distill complex data into actionable insights.

Strategic Vision:

Strong strategic thinking and problem-solving skills, with the ability to navigate complex business challenges and drive results.

Leadership Skills:

Demonstrated success in leading and developing teams, fostering a collaborative and inclusive environment.

Stakeholder Management:

Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with experience working across diverse teams and levels of an organization.

Industry Knowledge:

Familiarity with e-commerce, retail, or consumer goods is a plus.

Technical Skills:

Proficiency in data analysis tools (e.g., SQL, GBQ, Excel) and desire to roll-up sleeves alongside highly technical analysts to guide, review and improve code.  
Experience with pricing or financial modeling tools is desirable.

If you love to solve real business problems at scale, in a fast-paced, high growth and agile environment, this is the role for you!

Build rich, responsive and fast frontend experiences seen and used by millions of customers everyday
Write thoughtful, scalable, reusable, well tested and performant frontend code using frameworks such as React and Next
Partner with Design Leads and Product Managers to turn wireframes and mockups into responsive, consistent UIs that leverage our central React Pattern Library

Lead and implement action plans and coding patterns that influence the broader frontend platform at Wayfair
Be part of the team that is leading the market in delivering the most delightful customer online shopping experience for home furnishings in a quickly changing landscape

6+ years experience in Software Engineering with designing and building large scale platforms as a Full Stack Developer with Frontend heavy. 
Experience leading/supervising and/or mentoring engineers, leading code reviews, and establishing best engineering practices.
Passion for leading cross functional projects through collaboration and influencing design decisions.

A solid understanding of JavaScript state management libraries, such as Redux, MobX, or Apollo
Good understanding of modern programming languages such as Java, Python, PHP, C#, Go,Scala, or similar languages.
Desired, but not required, you know responsive design principles to allow web pages to adapt to different screen sizes and devices, making them accessible to a wider audience, cross-browser compatibility is a plus
Proficient in testing and debugging techniques to identify and fix issues in their code
A passion for UI, UX, and Design Systems and working with designers to create engaging and intuitive experiences across devices
Experience in working with product managers and designers to define, break down, and collaborate on feature work
A genuine believer in constructive and respectful code reviews, retros, and collaborative problem-solving as the bedrock of a healthy team
Great communication skills and the ability to support technical decision making with the team.

Title: Lead, Business Performance & Strategy
RoleDescription:
Who We Are
The Business Trends team collaborates with Wayfair's executive leadership and all business functions to identify, monitor, and address metric trends that drive Revenue and long-term Customer Lifetime Value (CLV). The team analyzes trends and develops a narrative on Wayfair's absolute and relative performance compared to competitors, both in the short-term and long-term. This allows Wayfair's senior leaders to quickly understand performance drivers, triage issues in real-time, and identify areas where plans need to be refined. Business Trends adds value by: 1) driving long-term CLV by unifying the organization around Wayfair's customer value proposition, tracking related input metrics, and driving interventions if customers are not reacting to improvements or if deviations from normal trends are observed; and 2) influencing partner teams to devote resources to areas of the business that need improvement in order to advance overall business performance and share taking.
The team is searching for a Manager to lead Trends for wayfair.co.uk, working directly with commercial leaders in the London office. The leader will be responsible for diagnosing overall business performance and building the narrative. In this role, you will partner closely with UK commercial leadership, including the UK GM, as well as with the wider Business Trends STO, including our Data Engineering team, to further develop self-service reporting.
 
What You'll Do

Analyse and present weekly performance insights for Wayfair.co.uk, and collaborate with partner teams to develop weekly steering decks.
Identify and analyse connections between Wayfair.com and Wayfair.co.uk trends, highlighting key similarities and differences.
Contribute to the Business Trends semi-annual roadmap.
Build and manage trackers using Google's Looker connected sheets to monitor trends for Business Trends and cross-functional partners.
Conduct cross-store investigations spanning Wayfair.com Business-to-Consumer (B2C), B2B, and Wayfair.co.uk. These can include macroeconomic pattern analysis, category/class trends, impact of policies, or experience issues.
Collaborate with peers and the Head of Business Trends to develop the monthly Trends Council narrative.
Partner with Business Trends Data Engineering to define additional needs for metrics & dimensions in the Business Trends Curated Data Layer.
Work with stakeholders to validate data insights and build hypotheses for potential interventions in response to trend deviations.

 
What You'll Need

4+ years of work experience in analytical, consulting, technology, start-up, or strategy roles.
Bachelors degree from a top-tier institution with a strong academic record in economics, math, statistics, engineering, business, or a related field.
Strong analytical skills  ability to develop analytical hypotheses and assumptions, use data software to conduct analyses, and synthesize findings.
Strong communication skills  ability to succinctly summarize findings, create a compelling narrative, and share/align messaging with stakeholders.
Strong business acumen  ability to understand how various parts of the business interact and how macro and competitive dynamics influence these.
Ability to learn and act quickly, make decisions, and draw conclusions in the face of ambiguity.
Advanced Excel/Google Sheets skills.
Intellectually curious, high energy, with a strong work ethic and a desire to work in a fast-paced, high-stakes team environment.
Experience with SQL or Google BigQuery is a plus.

Title: Junior Merchandiser
RoleDescription:
As a Junior Merchandiser, you will develop, execute and drive assortment strategies for your product class. Your ranges will become our Wayfair Verified items (Wayfairs super set of products that capture our highest % of revenue). You will influence how curated product ranges come to life across all Wayfair marketing channels (print, digital and social), ensuring accurate product representation and appropriate shelf placement. You will support strong cross functional relationships to ensure all strategies and goals are achieved, acting as the representative of the customer in strategic decisions on product placement. You will collaborate with Brand Management, Category Management, Marketing, Analytics & Operations, and external Suppliers to ensure the strategic vision is executed all the way to the customer. Leveraging data-driven qualitative and quantitative insights, you'll make a direct impact on overall sales, Wayfair share gains, and empower customers to create a home just right for them. 
 
What you'll do on any given day as a Curated Merchant...
As a Junior Merchandiser, you will be executing against our ambitious goals to shape our future curation strategy.  You will gain a deep understanding of the competitive market for your class. Leveraging this insight to build, curate, and maintain a category assortment strategy for our Wayfair Verified items, developing a shelf space plan and actively managing and iterating our product offering. You will ultimately decide which products will be highlighted and amplified across all marketing channels, with a crisp business justification to support your selection and robust alignment with key stakeholders. You will collaborate with cross-functional partners in Category Management, Promotion Operations, Marketing, Brand, Creative, Merchandising Operations, Analytics and external Suppliers in order to shape and solidify the direction of your class. Ensure your class range is competitive in both product and price.  You will know our customers needs better than anyone else and are constantly thinking about what tomorrows best sellers will be to continue to surprise and delight our target market.
Your success requires tenacity, agility, speed, an analytical mindset, collaboration, influence, and a competitive spirit. You'll use your executive presence to work with and influence stakeholders at all levels and navigate interesting, complex assortment challenges. You will own the performance results though regularly monitoring assortment health though various KPIs and OKRs.
 
What Youll Do 

Build and maintain class assortment strategies, inclusive of developing a shelf space plan and actively selecting, developing and iterating on the product offering
Identify opportunities for category growth, utilizing competitive analysis, trend research, and internal performance monitoring as data points
Partner closely with Category Management, Suppliers, Creative, Marketing, Analytics and Brand to determine how best to bring the selection to life in both digital and print
Maintain a close pulse on trends and customer needs to identify new assortment opportunities.  Partner with category management and external suppliers when curating the line plan to find products that deliver compelling newness and tomorrows best sellers.
Own the financial outcomes for the performance of the products you placed on the premium shelf spaces. Regularly assess performance and revise assortment and shelf space allocation strategy as needed.  
Domestic Travel [4x / month] to our QC & Video Studio operation to ensure product experience
International Travel [1-2x / year] Attend industry trade shows relevant to your categories to partner with strategic suppliers and further optimize our catalog    

 
Who You Are

A bachelor's or masters degree
Experience buying or merchandising trend-driven categories, curating assortments from a wide range of vendors and classifications, and developing compelling assortment presentations are all highly preferred.
Strong ability to analyze data and think critically, understand and interpret performance trends, and apply learnings to the business  
Strong creative sense, elevated taste level, and love of product.  A genuine passion for industry trends, product design, and home decorating is a plus.
Excellent communication/persuasion skills and ability to influence internal and external stakeholders to align behind and execute against a common goal
Capable of thriving in a high-growth environment in which defining clarity amidst ambiguity and operating in scrappy start-up building mode are everyday activities.  
Self-starter motivated by the potential to define a creative and strategic vision and have an outsized impact within a team and company
Ability to work from Wayfairs London office 3 days per week, Wayfairs Verified Studio 1 day per week in Birmingham &  1 day a week per week remote. Travel for competitor diligence & trade shows.

Who You Are

A bachelor's or masters degree

$19/hour

Overview:
As a Logistics and Inventory Specialist, youll play a critical role in ensuring seamless operations as Wayfair's Physical Retail team reimagines the shopping experience. From managing inventory flow and conducting audits to processing shipments and resolving discrepancies, your work will directly support an exceptional customer shopping experience. With a keen eye for detail and a proactive approach to problem-solving, this role will focus on maintaining inventory accuracy, resolving logistical exceptions, and optimizing efficiency. The ideal candidate thrives in a fast-paced environment, collaborates effectively with partner teams, and is passionate about owning and creating a flawless operational foundation reflecting Wayfairs commitment to a top-tier experience and retail excellence.
 
What Does a Logistics & Inventory Specialist Do?

Demonstrates Reliability: Attendance and commitment to being present and on time for your full shift each day is crucial. This helps ensure we're ready and available to help our customers when they need us most. For unexpected events or issues, we require our team members to be proactive in their communications and planning whenever possible.
Ensure Inventory Accuracy: Perform daily audits and maintain a robust Cycle Count Program to safeguard the integrity and accuracy of inventory records. Leverage scan technology to document carton-level details like condition, quantity, and location.
Manage Inventory Performance: Monitor aging inventory, process markdowns, and execute damage write-offs to maintain accuracy and efficiency. Handle vendor returns for recalls, dead stock, and overstock inventory while leveraging experience in inventory management or e-commerce to optimize processes.
Receive and Process Shipments: Unload and receive inventory with care, including the manual handling of large and heavy goods. Ensure all inventory is processed correctly, capturing detailed records of overages, shortages, or damages.
Proactively Monitor Systems: Use order management tools and Warehouse Management Software to track inventory movement, troubleshoot discrepancies, and maintain up-to-date records. Regularly review Cycle Count data using Google Sheets to identify and address gaps.
Audit Operations: Conduct regular and triggered audits for inbound and outbound trucks to ensure accurate processing and shipment flow.
Support Operational Excellence: Use a ticketing system to manage exceptions, resolve issues, and provide input on improving existing processes and tools based on your day-to-day experience.
Collaborate Across Teams: Partner with logistics leaders and other teams to streamline operations, share insights, and uphold Wayfairs commitment to operational excellence.
Adapt and Problem-Solve: Thrive in a fast-paced environment by taking ownership of inventory challenges, driving solutions, and ensuring smooth coordination between warehouse and retail operations.

 
What are the Job Requirements?
 
Education: High School Diploma or equivalent is required.
Inventory Control Experience: 1 to 3 years of inventory control experience, preferably in a retail environment, is required.
Distribution or Logistics Experience: 1+ year of experience in distribution or logistics is preferred.
Open Schedule Availability: You may be required to work a flexible schedule that in many cases may include nights, weekends, and holidays.
Customer Service Skills: Must possess excellent customer service skills, with the ability to communicate effectively and work well under pressure in a fast-paced environment.
Adaptability and Problem-Solving: Demonstrates the ability to adapt to evolving tools, systems, and processes to ensure operational excellence.
Technical Proficiency: Strong computer skills with experience in Microsoft Office or Google Suite are preferred.
Detail Orientation: Must be highly detail-oriented and organized, with a proven ability to manage complex inventory systems and workflows.

Occasional lifting, carrying, pushing, and pulling up to 50 lbs
Frequent repetitive motions and coordination
Constant handling, grasping, and communication (talking/hearing)
Ability to ascend/descend stairs and balance

Minimal hazards and seasonal temperature changes

We are creating a new, dynamic Procurement team and looking for a strong, visionary leader.
This is a sensational opportunity to utilise your leadership and strategic skills to carve a new, innovative approach to global digital logistics solutions with freedom of autonomy, and the backing of a well known brand.
